_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
Avantor Inc;, a Fortune 500 company, is a leading global provider of mission-critical products and services to customers in the biopharma, healthcare, education & government, and advanced technologies & applied materials industries. Our portfolio is used in virtually every stage of the most important research, development and production activities in the industries we serve. One of our greatest strengths comes from having a global infrastructure that is strategically located to support the needs of our customers. Our global footprint enables us to serve more than 225,000 customer locations and gives us extensive access to research laboratories and scientists in more than 180 countries. We set science in motion to create a better world.

Avantor operates the VWR International facilities located in the United States. Management is not only committed to offering superior supplies and
services, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. VWR International's safety and environmental policies are administered by the Distribution Director with the assistance from the corporate Senior Chemical Specialist, who all conduct periodic inspections of the facility to ensure compliance, and will oversee the entire safety and environmental programs, including the RMP Program.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE
VWR is located at 17750 East 32nd Place, in Aurora, Colorado. The facility is approximately 0.10 miles southwest of Interstate Highway 70. The area immediately surrounding the facility is urban with a mixture of commercial, industrial, and residential areas. The primary business of VWR International is a chemical storage/distribution facility. The regulated substances of concern are hydrochloric acid, hydrofluoric acid, ethyl ether, and chloroform. The largest container size for hydrofluoric acid and hy

drofluoric acid is 55 gallon containers. The largest container size for chloroform and ethyl ether is a 1,000 liter and 200 liter container, respectively. The containers are delivered by freight companies. The containers remain onsite until they are purchased by a customer, at which point they are picked up for delivery to the client.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION
STEPS
In order to operate the storage and distribution facility, VWR International complies with the EPA Risk Management Program. In addition, common industry standards, policies, and procedures are utilized to ensure safe practices are being performed. The facility is also ISO 9001 certified. 

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no significant releases that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantities of 10 lbs of chloroform, 100 lbs of ethyl ether, 100 lbs of hydrofluoric acid, or 5,000 pounds of hydrochloric acid, or the state requirement mandating immediate reporting of any release or threatened release of a hazardous material in the past five years (May 2016 - May 2021). In addition, there have been no injuries resulting from a release of an RMP regulated substance, nor any releases or "near misses" that warranted an internal incident investigation.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The Hazard Review Revalidation, performed on April 1, 2021, generated mitigation measures
(recommendations) to improve safety at the VWR International facility located in Suwanee, Georgia. The mitigation measure include additional training, key maintenance-related tests/inspections, enhanced emergency response policies and procedures. The VWR International safety committee is planning to complete several items, including the recommendations, over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for their employees. These changes include the following items:

- Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety/Plan Programs.
- Continu

e to have employee involvement in Safety/Plan development.
- Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.
- Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.
- Recommendation tracking for the technical studies is maintained by the Distribution Director.
